prompt:
You will read a short story that describes an everyday situation. Your task is to interpret why the character in the story responded in a certain way.

Henry is sitting at his desk and watching TV, and reluctantly switches off the TV with the remote control and picks up a textbook. Shortly after, his mother comes in the room and asks, "What have you been doing up here?" Henry responds: "Reading."


Your answer:
response: Henry responded with "reading" because he was caught by his mother not studying and instead watching TV. He may have felt guilty or embarrassed and wanted to avoid getting in trouble. By saying he was reading, he was able to justify his time spent
target: He does not want to get into trouble for not studying.
incorrect_literal: He has been reading for some time.
incorrect_lexical_overlap: He wants his mom to believe that he has been watching TV.
incorrect_social_convention: He does not want to offend his mom by not reading the books that she gave him.
